awardsHtml:
10 wins & 6 nominations

Primetime Emmy Awards

2020 Winner Primetime Emmy
Outstanding Documentary or Nonfiction Series
Jason Hehir (produced by) - Michael Tollin (executive producer) - Estee Portnoy (executive producer) - Curtis Polk (executive producer) - Connor Schell (executive producer) - Gregg Winik (executive producer) - Andy Thompson (executive producer)
2020 Nominee Primetime Emmy
Outstanding Picture Editing for a Nonfiction Program
Chad Beck - Devin Concannon - Abhay Sofsky - Ben Sozanski
2020 Nominee Primetime Emmy
Outstanding Directing for a Documentary/Nonfiction Program
Jason Hehir (For "Episode 7")

Cinema Eye Honors Awards, US

2021 Nominee Cinema Eye Honors Award
Outstanding Achievement in Editing in a Nonfiction Film or Series for Broadcast
Chad Beck - Devin Concannon - Abhay Sofsky - Ben Sozanski
2021 Nominee Cinema Eye Honors Award
Outstanding Achievement in Nonfiction Series for Broadcast
Jason Hehir

Guild of Music Supervisors Awards

2021 Winner GMS Award
Best Music Supervision for a Docuseries
Rudy Chung

American Cinema Editors, USA

2021 Winner Eddie
Best Edited Documentary - Non-Theatrical
Chad Beck - Devin Concannon - Abhay Sofsky - Ben Sozanski (Episode: "Episode I (2020)")

Image Awards (NAACP)

2021 Winner Image Award
Outstanding Documentary (Television)

PGA Awards

2021 Winner PGA Award
Outstanding Producer of Non-Fiction Television
Michael Tollin - Curtis Polk - Estee Portnoy - Andy Thompson - Gregg Winik - John Dahl - Libby Geist - Connor Schell - Peter Guber - Jason Hehir - Nina Krstic - Matt Maxson - Jacob Rogal - Alyson Sadofsky - Jon Weinbach (Season 1)

FOCAL International Awards

2021 Nominee FOCAL Award
Best Use of Footage in a Sports Production
Nina Krstic

Motion Picture Sound Editors, USA

2021 Nominee Golden Reel Award
Outstanding Achievement in Sound Editing - Non-Theatrical Documentary
Keith Hodne (supervising sound editor) (Episode: "Episode I (2020)")

Television Critics Association Awards

2020 Winner TCA Award
Outstanding Achievement in News and Information

Online Film & Television Association

2020 Winner OFTA Television Award
Best Reality or Non-Fiction Program
2020 Winner OFTA Television Award
Best Direction of a Variety, Reality or Non-Fiction Program

AAFCA TV Honors

2020 Winner AAFCA Award
Best Documentary
(Tied with Atlanta's Missing and Murdered: The Lost Children (2020))

Black Reel Awards for Television

2020 Winner Black Reel
Outstanding TV Documentary or Special
